# MultipeerConnectivityService

**Class**

A service that provides scene synchronization among all peers in a multipeer connectivity session.

## Declaration

```swift
class MultipeerConnectivityService
```

## Overview

RealityKit uses this class to automatically sync scenes with other connected devices running the same app. It leverages the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/MultipeerConnectivity] framework to automatically keep the scenes of all connected devices synchronized. To sync a RealityKit scene, create a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/MultipeerConnectivityService] object initialized with an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/MultipeerConnectivity/MCSession] and assign it to your scene’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene/synchronizationService] property.

```swift
let peerID = MCPeerID(displayName: UIDevice.current.name)
let session = MCSession(peer: peerID, securityIdentity: nil, encryptionPreference: .required)
arView.scene.synchronizationService = try?
MultipeerConnectivityService(session: self.session)
```

For more information on browsing for, and connecting to, other devices, see [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/MultipeerConnectivity].

## Creating a connectivity service

- **init(session:)**: Creates a new connectivity service.

## Getting the session

- **session**: The multipeer connectivity session used by the service.

## Managing ownership

- **owner(of:)**: Gets the device that owns a given entity.
- **giveOwnership(of:toPeer:)**: Transfers ownership of the given entity to the named network device.

## Finding an entity

- **entity(for:)**: Gets the entity with the given identifier.

## Pausing and resuming

- **stopSync()**: Stops multipeer synchronization.
- **startSync()**: Begins multipeer synchronization.

## Configuring the session

- **setHandshake(count:timeoutMs:)**: Configures handshake and timeout settings.

## Multipeer synchronization

- **Loading remote assets in multiplayer apps**: Ensure assets load on all connected peers before using them.
- **NetworkCompatibilityToken**: An opaque token used to check the networking compatibility between two peers in a multipeer connection.
- **NetworkCompatibilityToken.Compatibility**: Indicates whether two devices running RealityKit are compatible and able to connect and sync scenes.
- **TransientComponent**: An interface for components that aren’t saved to file or cloned.
